title.native: シャングリラ・フロンティア 2nd season

description:
The second season of Shangri-La Frontier.

Rakuro Hizutome only cares about one thing: beating crappy VR games. He devotes his entire life to these buggy games and could clear them all in his sleep. One day, he decides to challenge himself and play a popular god-tier game called Shangri-La Frontier. But he quickly learns just how difficult it is. Will his expert skills be enough to uncover its hidden secrets?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: シャングリラ・フロンティア〜クソゲーハンター, 神ゲーに挑まんとす〜 2nd season
Shangri-La Frontier: Kusoge Hunter, Kamige ni Idoman to su 2nd Season
Thợ săn Game rác thách thức Game cấp Thánh, Mùa 2

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: E-Sports
tags.description: Prominently features professional video game competitions, tournaments, players, etc.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.
_Note: Not to be confused with [横山由季](https://anilist.co/staff/164104/Yuki-Yokoyama)._

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

**Saitou Atsuko** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

[Twitter](https://x.com/motimoti_623)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/153857/)._
